Reviews.Title: “What happened to Your Brand?”
Reviews.Author: jdealman
Reviews.Content: I remember when Crowne Plaza was supposed to be Holiday Inn's premium hotel. Obviously not so anymore. I stayed at a Crowne Plaza in Accapulco a few years back and was not impressed. I figured it was because it was Mexico. Well this location further instilled my impression of Crowne Plaza as a 3 star hotel. I have stayed at Hampton Inns which are nicer than Crowne Plazas! Very mediocre. We had a 6:45 AM flight out of Montreal to NYC and needed a hotel close to airport. When leaving hotel to airport the next morning the whole hotel had a smell of VOMIT. I liked the free parking form my rental car. Otherwise their Holiday Inn a mile down was probably on par or maybe even better. The had to check out the pool after seeing the photos on Tripadvisor. What a let down! It really looked much smaller in person. I paid $79 and that may have been a bit excessive. The room was small and probably worth more like $59 per night. However, for some reason hotels at the Montreal Airport were more expensive than in town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and pool.”
Reviews.Author: skettyroad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite nice, clean, and has a nice pool with a waterslide. Perfect for young kids. The location is industrial (The view from our room was of a CN railyard and the parking lot, but I don't think it was much better on the other side of the hotel) and is a bit awkward to get to, but overall, we were quite happy with it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room at good rate for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: matteomontreal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night after a wedding that was in the reception hall located at the hotel. Nice rooms, comfy king bed, great tv. The wash room was a bit outdated but was kept clean. I ordered continental breakfast to the room for the following morning and for the price it was nice. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “RÃ©ception palace, great pool for the kids”
Reviews.Author: thescanner1
Reviews.Content: Location is near AirPort so be prepared to have some jet noises, our room was partially renovated but clean. LCD Tv, great place for receptions, pool is 4 feet deap but Nice water slide for kids! Nothing around since in industriel park. AirPort shuttle is Free every half hour. Breakfast was great for a buffet at around 10.00

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel but Cheap on providing a Complimentary Breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Sam847
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times in the past and have booked the hotel again for the upcomming Easter Break 2012. We like the fact that it is near the airport and the front desk makes sure you make your flight on time each and every time. They pick you up and drop you off which is a great service when time is of the essence. The facilities are very good, there is a great inviting pool and health club facilities. Free parking and a nice bar with snacks and TV's. The rooms are quiet and comfortable and any additional things you may require can called for at the main desk. We find this hotel to be extremly comfortable for a close to the airport hotel. My only gripe was that last time we visited we were unable to receive a complimentary Breakfast so we had to leave each morning to go out for breakfast down the road. Other than that annoyance staying here is comfortabe and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eric T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights (before and after our trip down south) and booked the park, sleep, fly package. The rooms are modern, well appointed, and nicely decorated. Prices were comparable to those of other lower end airport hotels. We ordered room service, ate a the hotel restaurant, and had drinks in the lobby bar... Staff were excellent and even gave us a few free drink coupons. We will definitely be back before our next flight.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay for a first time Montreal visit.”
Reviews.Author: Managerofthenight
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crown Plaza Montreal from Feb 16th -18th, 2012 on a gift voucher won at my work Christmas party. This was our first time visit to Montreal (me and my girlfriend), so we thought we cashed in the voucher before it expired. What we loved: - We were worried when we got there that it would be tough finding someone who spoke English, but from the girl who checked us in at the desk, to the banquet porter/room server, to the bartender, everyone spoke perfect English and delivered exceptional service. I requested a drink from the bartender on Friday afternoon, and though he did not have one ingredients for my drink, he found a clever substitute which made for a tasty drink. - we loved the room we were placed in, a king room on the sixth floor. The art style was excellent (though i know some who may not like it), not a single imperfection could be found on my part. The TV, the bed, bathroom, chair all top scores with us. - The peace and quiet was what we were looking for on this trip, and we got it throughout our stay. The lobby area was perfect for catching up on reading, the gym was peaceful for a great workout, and though we had an adjoining room any noise from our neighbor we could not hear (Were not saying that walls are soundproof, just we had a quiet neighbor). Minor issues I found: - When we checked in we found multiple cups in the hallway that would remain there till the morning. The room service tray we put out one night was next to our door early in the morning. I think the room service staff should remove trays and cups each night. - Location near winding and confusing roads in the area turned us off, not on the Crown Plaza, but to that part of Montreal. Didn't help we were first timers who spoke no french though. Thank god I had my GPS or we would have been lost for sure. - Wanted to get some chips and a KitKat from the gift ship there but it was closed. Went to speak to the guest services representative to ask when the shop would open, and she said the woman who runs it keeps unusual hours so she did not know when it would open again. We ended up waiting about 5 hours until it opened in the evening to get some snacks. Setting regular hours for the gift shop would be something to look into. All in all, besides the crazy driving this was a great Montreal holiday, and a great Crown Plaza stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: bettylopez10
Reviews.Content: We were given a room on the 9th floor for Priority Club members. Our room was small and the bed was quite small for queen size The internet,airport shuttle, and parking is free but breakfast is not free. Bathroom is also small.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and nicely decorated”
Reviews.Author: econabree
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I stayed here recently for a girls weekend and we were very pleased. The hotel is located at the top of the 520 near Ikea and the 40 so it was easy to go anywhere in the West Island or Downtown. The lobby is standard, bar is very comfortable with dark leather club chairs. The pool is a good size, with a pretty decent slide (My kids would have loved it). Our suite had laminate floors in the living area and carpet in the bedroom, which was a nice change. It also had a small kitchenette with 2 fridges, a microwave and sink which was awesome for re-heating a midnight snack :) We asked for extra coffee and creamers, which were delivered promptly. The sofa bed was ok, but the bed was wonderfully comfortable. The bathroom was nice and roomy, with a rain shower head and nice size jacuzzi tub. I'd definitely go back for the location, bar service and general feel of the room.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful end to a not so wonderful day.”
Reviews.Author: redheadmom07
Reviews.Content: I was flying from Winnipeg to Moncton when my flight was delayed and delayed and delayed making me miss my connecting flight in Montreal. After travelling and being in an airport all day I was in a pretty bad mood. Air Canada put me up in the Crowne Plaza as part of their Trip interruption program. All I can say is Wow. Took the shuttle from the airport and check in was a breeze. There was a very loud wedding going on so I asked to not be put on that floor since I had a 6AM flight. They nicely put me on their "Quiet" floor. The room was beautiful and the bed had 6 pillows on it and a kit with earplugs, a sleep mask and linen spray. I went to the bar to get something to eat because I hadnt eaten dinner and even though it was 15 min before they closed the kitchen they still put the order through and the food came out quickly with wonderful service. If I am ever in Montreal again I will definately stay at the Crowne Plaza Airport Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimonYYZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights at the end of December 2011. The hotel staff here are friendly and efficient. Rooms are fair sized with a new flat screen t.v., coffee maker, fridge, clock radio, and the usual extras. Had the Prime Rib dinner special one night in the restaurant. It was decent value at $22.95 and included choice of salad or soup of the day, baked potato and vegetables, and of course the large portion of prime rib. The house wine is fairly priced at $17 per half litre. There aren't many other food options around here. However, when you walk out of the hotel, and turn left, a couple of buildings down (I think the address is 1700) there is a cafe inside an office building, which serves delicious and inexpensive breakfast and lunch Monday-Friday. Just walk in the front door you will easily spot it. Other than that, overall, I would easily stay here again. Wi-fi is also included, and apparently they offer a free transfer to Trudeau International Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Totally blown away!What a great surprise -one of the best airport hotels I've ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: Dealguru
Reviews.Content: Totally blown away! What a great surprise -one of the best airport hotels I've ever stayed at!!

Reviews.Title: “Better options around the airport...”
Reviews.Author: Suman514
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because I was attending a wedding there. The actual bedroom was spacious (king room had room for a couch), but the bed wasn't very comfortable for me. Not sure what was going on with blanket/duvet, but it was hard to fall asleep with it (felt rough). The bathroom was tiny, and quite retro. Needs to be renovated. Again, let me re-iterate "tiny." Bring your own toiletries. The brand they had (not a brand I know) did not cut it for me. Check-in staff were nice enough, although there weren't enough behind the desk when I was checking in. I am disappointed by the lack of service when I told them that I had lost something in one of the banquet halls. The halls are probably under separate management, but I am disappointed that no one has called me back to this day (I even left my cell number). I've stayed at other hotels by the airport, and there are plenty of better options. Note: the hotel is a 5 min drive from the airport, and about a 30 min drive from downtown Montreal. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Good for 1 or 2 nights only”
Reviews.Author: parismec
Reviews.Content: I recently needed a reasonably priced hotel near the airport, so I chose what I thought would be a chain with a good name. Unfortunately, no matter how nice the people were, it is in desperate need of a makeover. The carpets and hallways were dirty, the elevators take forever to get up and down, the room not clean (paint, carpet, bathroom tiles), but certainly a layover place for travelers. That being said, it was reasonably priced and convenient to the airport with a free shuttle that left very early in the morning. So one or two nights maximum is my advice, and you should survive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashlessinseattle
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is around 10-15 minutes drive from Montreal's Trudeau airport and a free shuttle runs every 30 minutes. I have platinum status with ICHotels so I was upgraded to a corner suite on arrival and found the room, hotel, staff - everything to be of the standard I expect from this hotel chain. I can't speak for the restaurant as I didn't use it but the bar and bar food were fine. You don't usually get many surprises from this hotel chain and this was no exception. There are a lot of hotels around Trudeau so you have your choice (including at least 2 Holiday Inn's within stone-throwing distance of this Crowne Plaza). I chose to stay at this hotel on this occasion because of price and generally was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good pick if you stay one night on your way to somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: jfcovi
Reviews.Content: I am actually writing the review from the hotel. Rooms are clean, modern, spacious. Location is not optimal and the service is a bit shaky. I had to phone several Times for a room service order. Staff is friendly and helpful. Property is Nice but not so well located . Taxi fare from YUL costs 16 CAD

Reviews.Title: “Rodent infested!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine3456
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! This hotel is absolutely terrible. The first time I stayed here I was having dinner with my coworkers in the downstairs restaurant, and we saw a rat run across the floor. As I have no choice where I stay for work, I found myself at this hotel just over a month later. I wanted to give it a second chance, thinking perhaps they took some care to the issue. I got into my hotel room, and there were black hairs all over the bath tub. Not going to kill me, but it's still disgusting. Slept the night, and woke up in the afternoon and was sitting on my bed watching tv. I got a little bit of an wary feeling, looked down beside my bed and there was a MOUSE! Filthy! I wanted to vomit. I talked to other colleagues who also found rodents in their rooms. Don't waste your money staying here and risk getting sick.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: YTOAY
Reviews.Content: Spend one night was upgraded to executive floor, room is clean. Coffee shop waiter was impressive, asked if I want toast white or whole wheat, muffin etc. Usually for buffet breakfast you choose your own and waiter just refill your coffee. Will return to this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Sab F
Reviews.Content: To begin with, the hotel needs updating from the outside. It looks like it hasn't been touched since 1970. I was served by the front desk manager i believe and found him to be a bit stressed. It was pretty obvious he was new and didn't really know what he was doing. He couldn't even smile. I walked in the room and found it to be very nice but some hairs on the bed and the lamps very dusty. Oh and apparently the hotel is right by the airport? it's atleast a 10mins drive. Overall, very dissapointing and won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel! Excellent value deal on hotwire”
Reviews.Author: FWM2011
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I really don't get the tripadvisor reviews. I booked this hotel on hotwire for $88+ tax and was "shocked" when I read the reviews after the successful purchase. Anyway - once at the hotel I was positively surprised. The entire hotel has been renovated (for quite a while now according to the friendly front desk staff) and the rooms are really nice. Very clean, comfy beds, nice flat screen TV, nice bedroom and they even have the "higher end" gimmicks you find at Grand Hyatts / nicer Westins (LED reading lights at the bed, rain shower head in shower). So definitely no complaints there... Airport shuttle bus runs every 30min and 24hrs - although I'd be prepared for a little wait during off-peak hours (we took the 5:30am bus this morning and had to wait until 5:50am... not a big deal though...definitely better than some Hilton shuttle bus operations I've experienced). The only cons for our stay were: - noisy A/C window unit - the sink in the shower was stained and had brown circles around... not a huge issue as the rest of the room was very clean, but still... come on Crowne Plaza... use some bleach.... overall a great hotel at the YUL airport (shuttle bus takes 20min'ish to the airport) and I would definitely stay there again. Despite being straight next to a major road, the rooms are pretty quiet and you won't hear street noise...

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: bandrubber
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work, and given that I didn't pay for my stay and still feel the need to complain, must show how disappointed I was with the service I received. At first I thought everything was going to be okay - my room looked clean, and it was a decent size. Then I went into the shower and found a hair on the shower head. My colleague who was staying in a different room found a dirty towel in her bathroom, hanging on the door. In the bed, I found a couple of hairs as well - and a couple in the pillow under the case which was open on one end. Then came time to sleep - at 330 AM my sleep was disturbed by someone staying in the hotel who started banging on a neighbour's door. It took security forever to do anything. Never mind the fact that they started cleaning up the rooms around 630 am and with paper thin walls, the banging did nothing but keep me up. I ordered room service for breakfast the following morning, and was told it would be ready soon. Having waited at least 40 minutes I called back asking how long it would still be. I was told it would be there soon and was then hung up on. She called back a minute later to tell me it'd be there in about 5 minutes - guess she realized her job was on the line. For what it's worth, I did use the gym, which was pretty decent. But overall, I would not recommend staying here. If for some reason you do stay here and take a cab, don't tell the cab driver the hotel is near the airport (despite the hotel's name), as they'll drive you right to the airport and blame you for misdirection.

Reviews.Title: “Abysmal in every way. Past its use by date”
Reviews.Author: BruceandCarolHyland
Reviews.Content: Everything was terrible about this tired old excuse for a hotel - supposedly an airport hotel, yet a 20 minute drive from the equally dismal airport. Building was tired and dirty - like a trip back to the 1970's. Room had been upgraded, but the effort could not overcome the poor housekeeping and attention to details. Food and Beverage was like a "Last Chance Saloon" Worst pretend four star hotel that I have ever stayed in around the world. Thanks goodness it was only a night!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: sallan71
Reviews.Content: The only problem with the hotel is that it is somewhat dated and a little inconvenient if you are there for more than just a stopover. Great pool, below average fitness centre and a friendly little social bar. The staff were great and the hotel was certainly clean enough but could really use some more renovations to bring it up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended place for a family reunion”
Reviews.Author: edgarcaron
Reviews.Content: All 23 members at our family reunion were very pleased with the overall excellent service, quality of the rooms and the cuisine. Also with the amenities i.e. indoor pool with a 120 foot waterslide. The only negative is the accounting department, they do not return your telephone calls. My credit card was charged the day following our stay. A month and a half later I finally got a copy of my billing invoice after a request was made to the Group Sales Manager.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: montecarlo_xyz
Reviews.Content: How can this be a 4 star hotel? Firstly, they got our room mixed up with someone else's. Secondly, the bathroom was filthy! HAIRS on the bathroom floor and in the bathtub! You would have to be blind not to see them. It was absolutely disgusting. Service was not much better either. UGH! What a poor excuse for a 4 star hotel. The hallway was also really dark and dingy! Just don't waste your money here. We had no choice but to stay here.... unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Horrible! Horrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: psimon924
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding that was held at this hotel. The rooms were small and disgusting. My kids did not want to use the toilet or take a shower because of the less than clean cramped bathroom. The service was also horrible. Our room was not cleaned the day after we checked in. We called the front desk at 5:30pm to ask that the room be cleaned. They seemed very annoyed at our request, but eventually came. The only good part was the banquet hall which was very nice. We will never stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tired Hotel urgently needing updating”
Reviews.Author: Colin3160
Reviews.Content: We were excited to draw this hotel on Priceline. After all the Crowne Plaza group of hotels are renowned for their quality and good hotels. However we were terribly dissapointed when we arrived at the hotel. Not only is it situated alongside a busy highway but it is a tired hotel urgently needing updating. The colour scheme of the public areas is drab, the rooms are drab. The whole atmosphere is depressing! Avoid this one if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for local business”
Reviews.Author: jetcaptain
Reviews.Content: Ok place to stay if you have business in the local area. Good shuttle to airport about ten min away.

Reviews.Title: “for one night”
Reviews.Author: annemaBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Layover in montreal for me so I have been directed to the hotel for the night, it is not exactly close to the airport but there is a shuttle. The rooms are just renovated and very nice with space, tea coffee making facility but I had a room with a Jacuzzi that did not work. The restaurant is pathetic with tables in line in a dark room, chairs from one of the conference rooms, what a sad atmosphere, no music, the food is just ok.

Reviews.Title: “The room had all the little touches that make the difference between just a place and a nice place”
Reviews.Author: Jim-OnTheWayHome
Reviews.Content: Last time I stayed an hour out of town and paid more for a Super 8 than I paid for this motel. I am more likely to stay in a $30 motel if I can find one just to put this review in to perspective. I called from the airport and the person who answered the phone was bilingual (another motel I called, I had to wait a couple of minutes for someone who spoke English-and their price was more). They said a shuttle would be there in five minutes and it was. Shuttle driver also spoke fluent English. I realize that I am in a 'foreign' country as a guest, but it is really nice to be accommodated by EVERYONE in my own language. No problems at check in, very helpful. Everything I saw was in tip-top shape, if anything I would say this place is underpriced. The room had all the little touches that make the difference between just a place and a nice place. (I see that someone commented about the view ... you are in a city, a few minutes from the airport. Sorry, there aren't mountains, water and trees) I don't see the restaurant listed on Trip Advisor so I'll include it here. I had the lasagna, it was good ... I ate it all including all the sauce and all the bread with no room for soup, salad or deserts. The restaurant looked more like an event center with the high ceilings and rows of tables. See pics

Reviews.Title: “Industrial wasteland”
Reviews.Author: CKMwindsor
Reviews.Content: This is no 3.5 star hotel.... maybe 2? Upon entrance to the parking lot we were disappointed. It didn't get better. The elevator was glacial in movement and filled with service providers. So we thought we'd try the stairs. The stairs to nowhere. Got up to our room. The crack in the glass window is held together with masking tape. Checked out the gym. Upstairs from the pool... but couldn't access through the main door... had to go around. Not worth the visit. The hotel is bustling with wedding and first communion celebrations. Guess that's the niche. The money saved not worth the convenience to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Someone's dirty wears were left in the corner...”
Reviews.Author: peppermintpatty07
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well maintained on the main lobby level although, the rooms (even though somewhat renovated and modern), were done so cheaply that the carpets were too small for the room, the paint was chipping and the laminate floors were buckling. The first room we had, the tub was rusted and the shower head did not work. The second room was large; albeit dirty - very dirty with someone's underwear being left by the cleaning staff in the corner of our room upon arrival. The bed was so close to the bathroom door that we had to move it in order to get in and out. To top it off, there was toothpaste splatter on the mirror and walls of the bathroom. Disgusting. I have been to this hotel before but, will never return to stay that is for certain. Beds were comfortable but, after reading about bed bugs from other TA reviewers... somehow loses the grandeur of a good night's sleep and makes you wonder. Front staff member was sympathetic and a pleasure to deal with although, room fees were not comped but discounted. Swimming pool was great for the kids - the best part of our 1 night stay. Sadly, would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty! Glad I did not pay!”
Reviews.Author: Bose2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after being stuck at the airport; my flight was delayed because of the weather. The airline company paid for my stay and my meal, I'm sure glad they did because this place was awful! It's renovated, but there is gross stuff everywhere; sticky floors, hair everywhere (even on the bed), white stuff on the comforter; everything was grossing me out! The restaurant is sketchy and the manager/waiter that waited on me was an odd character. My impression about him was right, because I just checked my credit card bill and I was charged full price for my meal, they took my voucher but did not apply it to my bill. If there is one thing that I cannot stand is cleanliness issues, this is one of my worst hotel stay EVER in that regard!!! The only positive thing I can say about this property is; the friendly staff (minus the waiter/manager at the restaurant), most of them were quite nice, from the front desk to the shuttle driver.

Reviews.Title: “Not Our Choice”
Reviews.Author: Wet_Coast1
Reviews.Content: We had to stay overnight due to an Air Canada mechanical problem, so the airline provided us with this hotel room and meal vouchers. We were not able to use the meal vouchers as the kitchen was closed when we arrived (around 10:00pm). There were no restaurants nearby, so we were directed to the vending machine. My teenage son had a small package of chips for "dinner". The room was comfortable enough but I would never choose to stay here. We left the hotel at 6:30am before the kitchen was open, so we weren't able to get breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug”
Reviews.Author: Shermie4
Reviews.Content: Need I say more? Honestly, we were moved to another room immediately, but the damage was done. It could not have been handled any better by the manager. Also, this hotel had several events on the Saturday night, so parking was an issue as was noise from the entertainment, until 1 a.m., even on the fourth floor.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with lush rooms and plenty of nice touches.”
Reviews.Author: stigs17
Reviews.Content: Pros: Attractive lobby with rooms to match. Clean, modern, well-equipped rooms with large flat Samsung plasmas with ~50 channels (no HD), a large work area, small sofa, chic artwork, two large mirrors, CD alarm clock and a safe. Size of room is comparable to the Holiday Inn franchise, thus a bit smaller than a standard Crowne Plaza offering, but still very functional. Comfortable bed, great for those who like a firm mattress. Heat worked well and the unit was very quiet. Instant hot water and good shower pressure. Nice soundproofing of windows; on the 4th floor, I could not hear any of the steady traffic on Cote de Liesse. Efficient check-in and check-out. Free parking. Easy access to highways 40 (east/west) and 15 (north/south). Fantastic pool area; loved the slide. The young bartender Francois at Bar Connexion was terrific. Cons: For rooms with connecting doors, expect to hear every word spoken on the TV or in the room next door due to poor soundproofing around these doors. Alas, I had some obnoxious women next door who were clearly inebriated by 8pm. No fridge or microwave in the room; I presume the locked cabinet contained these. Bathtub displayed a great deal of rust throughout; needs to be replaced to bring it in line with the quality of the rest of the room. Very little within walking distance in this industrial area; one has to drive to get anywhere, though there is a steakhouse and hockey arena nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Bug, Bugs and more bugs”
Reviews.Author: What_An_Experience81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza for two nights because a good friend of mine was getting married. When we walked in, the lobby looked very modern and classy. We were given room 204 and it looked nice, but horrible lighting. We began unpacking and found a roach in the bathroom the size of a pinky nail. We had no choice but to stay at the hotel since we had a wedding the next night. In the 2 day stay, we killed about 5 roaches mainly in the bathroom but also in the bedroom. Upon checkout, I told them about our experience since the stay was horrible. Although they provided me with a small discount, I called to complain about our experience. They told me they had exterminators come into the room and all they could find was humidity bugs!? I looked up humidity bugs and what we were killing all weekend was not that.....they were roaches. The wedding was beautiful....the hotel was HORRIBLE!!! Needless to say I will never be staying at the hotel again and I am traumatized from the disgusting experience. If you have a choice, do not stay there but if you have to.....don't stay in room 204!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel - terrible food”
Reviews.Author: edge1136
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on business with a few colleagues. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and relaxing. The desk was large enough to work from. Free wi-fi was certainly a plus. The only negative for this hotel is the Restaurant Volare. The descriptions of the dishes were great but the execution was subpar. I had veal scallopini and the meat was greasy. A colleague of mine has the roast beef special. The picture of the dish showed a medium rare piece of meat 1/2" inch thick. What showed up was a brown piece of very fatty meat that was less the a 1/4" inch thick. In the morning we went down for breakfast and had the buffet. Scambled egges were sitting is water. Actually all of the meat that were in warmers will sitting in water and looked pale. I would recommend the hotel for a night stay, but make other plans to eat.

Reviews.Title: “cleanliness issues within the room”
Reviews.Author: ASA07
Reviews.Content: Infrastructure OK - good size rooms and modern but serious cleanliness issues

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: sens1992
Reviews.Content: This is an older property that was somehow renovated. The lobby area and restaurant are pretty new. The elevators would need some upgrades... The room itself was nice. A very modern look and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was very small and the bathtub was rusted (drain)... This should be fixed. However, it was very clean. We ordered room service (breakfast) and it was very good (fast delivery too). The price was also very low which is rare in such hotels for room service orders... Staff was courteous and friendly. Also, they have an awesome pool and waterslide! I would for sure, return to the Crowne Plaza Montreal Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value near Airport”
Reviews.Author: erikTRVL
Reviews.Content: Better than expected for an airport hotel and excellent value. Easy evening checkin and one of the only places around to get dinner at 10pm. The Italian restaurant in the hotel was excellent and exceeded expectations plus resonably priced for the family. Great location to get an early start on the raod and by pass the infamous Montreal traffic and construction.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: GotBud
Reviews.Content: Rooms very clean and quiet even though I did not stay on the quiet zone floor. Bed very comfortable. Decor modern and plenty of room. Small challenge at the beginning with the key card not working. Staff very prompt to correct with a new card. However, once the key worked, still could not enter the room due to the hook lock was on the door. Again, another call to the desk. Staff within a couple of minutes came up with a key to another room that had no issues. Room service was quick to respond to my order. However, for some reason they brought more food than was ordered and charged accordingly. They quickly adjusted the bill with great curtousy. The food was very good. Despite the small issues, overall I recommend this hotel given they are very responsive to the customers requests in a timely manner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Hotwire rate”
Reviews.Author: Bear55
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with Hotwire rate. Rooms have been upgraded, bathrooms small yet very upscale. Nice bar.

Reviews.Title: “Pool closes at 6pm - what????”
Reviews.Author: pea_green_boat
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to sleep during an overnight layover in Montreal. We chose the Crowne Plaza because it looked like it had a great swimming complex with slides, etc. You can imagine my disappointment when we get to the hotel at 6:15, check-in, and discover the pool was closed at 6pm. I can understand 10:00 or even 9:00, but 6:00?? I didn't think to ask when the pool would be closed because NEVER have I heard of one closing so early. i won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “OK but difficult access”
Reviews.Author: EarlRosebery
Reviews.Content: Hotel was recently refurbished and clean. Rooms and bathrooms comfortable but small and noisy (earplugs supplied). Very comfortable bed. Free wi fi. Inexpensive quality breakfast. Helpful fron tdesk. Nice pool Difficult access because there are limited, poorly marked underpasses to get to the other side of the divided highway. If you go too far east in order to turn back to the airport you will arrive at the gridlock of the Decarie interchange. Good price on hotwire rated 3.5 stars

Reviews.Title: “Pool with slide great for a birthday party!”
Reviews.Author: beanlady
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight with my partner and 7 kids (his, mine and several others) for my son's 9th birthday party. Booked 2 adjoining rooms with a cot for $20 extra bucks at a gov't rate and it probably cost less than his last party. Pool has a great slide and was the selling point to booking this hotel; lifeguard on duty...kids had a great time swimming. Front desk service was great...I called several times to ask for a fridge and a cot in the weeks previous to our visit and always had great service, even gave me pizza menus to order for the kids when they finally dragged themselves out of the pool. Rooms were modern with flat screen tv's and comfortable beds. Sign warning that rooms were being renovated...only indication was in the bathroom, where the paint was peeling a bit and the tub could use some updating. Despite that, new fixtures more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel & Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: legend2x
Reviews.Content: The physical appearance is good since newly renovated. The room has almost everything you need, internet, LCD TV, safe, iron, and more. The service was friendly and outstanding. Here are the drawbacks: 1. There are only two outlets in the room, one in the bathroom and second on the desk. 2. The house-keeping needs to clean the excessive hair from the bathtub. 3. All vending machines from 2nd to 6th Floor are "out of order". You have no choice but to use the mini-bar. The manager simply said that they called in for couple weeks, but it's not done yet. 3. The breakfast buffet can definitely be better. 4. The house-keeping vacuums the hallways in the middle of the night disturbing my sleep. 5. The mattress and pillows aren't comfortable. Overall, it was a good choice of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: hwy401
Reviews.Content: Awarded this on Priceline. A Dorval Airport property. The first thing I look for, once I've gotten past basic safety, cleanliness, and decor, is the availability of a convenient electrical outlet for my laptop. This renovated room fails the test -- no electrical plug by the bed, none along the wall beside the bed. Fortunately, I brought an extension cord and was able to jerry rig some power from the electrical plug built-in to the desk light. I'm using it to write this review. The wireless internet signal is strong (I'm on the 5th floor), and there's no sign-in mumbo-jumbo to go through. The room is clean and functional, but small. The bathroom is also quite small. Not what you usually associate with the Crowne Plaza brand. The only chair in the room is the desk chair -- the room is probably too small for an easy chair, so it's not great for curling up with a book, or watching TV from a comfortable chair. For those of you bringing your earthly treasures, there's an in-room safe. There also appears to be a locked honor bar. And, there's a bottle of something on the bed. Inspection reveals that it is a bottle of linen mist, presumably for inducing some kind of aromatherapeutic state prior to slumber. The carpets in the hallway are a strangely disturbing red-grey combo with some circley things along one side only. Do not attempt to navigate the hallway while intoxicated or on strong medications. Perhaps the in-room linen mist helps overcome the disorientation caused by walking the hallway. In the elevator waiting area, there's a blast of air from a vent in the wall that easily equals the ones used to dry a car in a car wash. I mean, the artificial tree is swaying in the breeze, and the pages of the top newspaper in the pile of newspapers are blowing. That's about it. There's a flat-screen TV on the wall; you can use it to watch the Canadian curling championships.

Reviews.Title: “Would Go Back”
Reviews.Author: duely0205
Reviews.Content: The hotel was all good with the service, pool for my son, & even a bus stop right in front of the hotel.But the only flaw was the menu for dinner & supper time was not the best suited for children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff meeting every guest's needs”
Reviews.Author: sleepy_9
Reviews.Content: We checked in to our room with an adjoining door & could hear nearly every word from the next room, including the coughing fit a man was having. Immediately we called the front desk to get us another room. We were in our new room within 5 minutes. The rooms were beautifully decorated without a flaw. Our room had plenty of space with a great view of the airport & city lights @ night. The halls were exceptionally quiet! This is the quietest & prettiest hotel stay I have had. Every question we had was answered quickly, professionally & was just the answer we wanted to hear. Great staff, beautiful facility & quiet halls! Definitely worth many more stays!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated, Luxurious bargain”
Reviews.Author: leofreeman
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton four points has recently re-branded and renovated as the Crown Plaza. The improvements are really nice. The pool still has the long slide for the kids. The rooms now feature nice modern bedding and pillows and flat screen TV's. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A functional hotel, convenient for the airport”
Reviews.Author: officeadmin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good from a functional point of view - ie if you need to be close to Montreal airport. 'It is located in the middle of a cultural desert, surrounded by major roads and warehouse parks, so the guy who found it perfect for a Valentine's Day stay obviously didn't get out of the room much. The refurbished rooms are nice, bathrooms a bit small. The unrefurbished restaurant is well past its sell-by date. If you want to use their wireless internet, ask for a room on a lower floor - the signal is very weak on floor 8. Worth phoning to negotiate a room rate - a guy came in off the street while I was waiting in the lobby and agreed a rate far lower than my internet rate from the hotel's website (which was cheaper than any of the other cheap agencies).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: mochan
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay. Beautiful new rooms and comfortable beds... The rooms have just been renovated and iloved the plasma TV's. The staff was really friendly and helped to find things to do in the area in the evening. I really enjoyed my stay and will definately stay there again the next time I have to go to Montreal.

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Hotel Montreal Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 6600 Cote de Liesse, Montreal, Quebec H4T 1E3, Canada
